data.title: Cleveland Cavaliers Roster
data.meta_description: Cleveland Cavaliers scores, news, schedule, players, stats, rumors, depth charts and more on RealGM.com
data.text:
Carlos Boozer was selected as the #6 pick in the Second Round of the 2002 NBA Draft by the Cleveland Cavaliers. Carlos Boozer signed a multi-year contract with the Cleveland Cavaliers on August 7, 2002.

DeSagana Diop was selected as the #8 pick in the First Round of the 2001 NBA Draft by the Cleveland Cavaliers. DeSagana Diop signed a multi-year contract with the Cleveland Cavaliers on July 5, 2001.

Zydrunas Ilgauskas was selected as the #20 pick in the First Round of the 1996 NBA Draft by the Cleveland Cavaliers. Zydrunas Ilgauskas signed a multi-year contract with the Cleveland Cavaliers on August 1, 1996. Zydrunas Ilgauskas signed a multi-year extension with the Cleveland Cavaliers on January 29, 1999.

LeBron James was selected as the #1 pick in the First Round of the 2003 NBA Draft by the Cleveland Cavaliers. LeBron James signed a multi-year contract with the Cleveland Cavaliers on July 3, 2003.

Jason Kapono was selected as the #2 pick in the Second Round of the 2003 NBA Draft by the Cleveland Cavaliers. Jason Kapono signed a multi-year contract with the Cleveland Cavaliers on July 30, 2003.

Dajuan Wagner was selected as the #6 pick in the First Round of the 2002 NBA Draft by the Cleveland Cavaliers. Dajuan Wagner signed a multi-year contract with the Cleveland Cavaliers on July 16, 2002.

Tony Battie was acquired in a trade by the Cleveland Cavaliers from the Boston Celtics on December 15, 2003.

Ruben Boumtje-Boumtje was acquired in a trade by the Cleveland Cavaliers from the Portland Trail Blazers on January 21, 2004.

Kedrick Brown was acquired in a trade by the Cleveland Cavaliers from the Boston Celtics on December 15, 2003.

Jeff McInnis was acquired in a trade by the Cleveland Cavaliers from the Portland Trail Blazers on January 21, 2004.

Eric Williams was acquired in a trade by the Cleveland Cavaliers from the Boston Celtics on December 15, 2003.
